title: Python interpreter died without Traceback when CPU Tensor divided by zero.
body_html:
There's no Traceback when a cpu tensor is divided by zero.

i.e.

$ python3
Python 3.6.5 (default, May 11 2018, 13:30:17) 
[GCC 7.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> a = torch.LongTensor([1,2]).cuda()
>>> a/0
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 3: divide by zero at /pytorch/aten/src/THC/generic/THCTensorMathPairwise.cu:88
>>> a = torch.LongTensor([1,2])
>>> a/0
Floating point exception  #######No Traceback, just exit without any indication.
$ echo $?
136

If there is no Traceback, it will be difficult to locate the bugs.

What about raising an exception instead of just aborting ?

Environment:
Python 3.6 provided by Debian Testing, PyTorch 0.4.0 installed with pip3 (pytorch compiled from source has the same behavior), CUDA 9.1, cudnn 7.1.

Thanks
